body: thanks again @szymonlesisz

Hi again, thanks for quick fixes yesterday :)
I've updated version to 6.8.4 and found out that this issue still got some side effects.
`clearErrors` doesn't remove `errors.nestedField.key` anymore but sets them as undefined instead.

I've updated my CSB, pls use the same steps as in description (step 1, step 2) but this time watch for console log.
https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-useform-template-forked-j4wqk?file=/src/index.js

Expected behaviour:
After "Step 2" `errors` object should be empty

![Screenshot 2020-09-22 at 10 32 23](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3435913/93860256-1933ce00-fcbf-11ea-8906-f1337b570e43.png)

> Hi again, thanks for quick fixes yesterday :)
> I've updated version to 6.8.4 and found out that this issue still got some side effects.
> `clearErrors` doesn't remove `errors.nestedField.key` anymore but sets them as undefined instead.
> 
> I've updated my CSB, pls use the same steps as in description (step 1, step 2) but this time watch for console log.
> https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-useform-template-forked-j4wqk?file=/src/index.js
> 
> Expected behaviour:
> After "Step 2" `errors` object should be empty
> 
> ![Screenshot 2020-09-22 at 10 32 23](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3435913/93860256-1933ce00-fcbf-11ea-8906-f1337b570e43.png)

that's expected, for individual node we can only set the error to `undefined`, if you want to clear the whole array field error use the `key`.

I wrote unexpected because this is not how it works with 6.7.2
My "submit button" is enabled on condition `Object.keys(errors).length === 0` and this change kinda breaks it so i was assuming that this is a bug 

Does it mean that i need to filter `undefined` errors from every nested field from now on? or is there a better way to check "if there are no errors"?

> I wrote unexpected because this is not how it works with 6.7.2
> My "submit button" is enabled on condition `Object.keys(errors).length === 0` and this change kinda breaks it so i was assuming that this is a bug
> 
> Does it mean that i need to filter `undefined` errors from every nested field from now on? or is there a better way to check "if there are no errors"?

- This was patched by a bug because we used to unset `errors` by `name`, which lead to this unexpected behavior when user just want to clear a single error not an entire node of errors. issue reference: https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/issues/2730
- If clear an object key, then yes we should clear the entire error object for that key, if only particular field, we can't assume the other fields in the object doesn't have an error or has, hence set to `undefined1` is the easy and simplest solution. 
- why are you checking for errors length? shouldn't you rely on `isVaid`?
I've tried `formState.isValid` but it is set to `false` at this point (see my updated CSB)

> I've tried `formState.isValid` but it is set to `false` at this point (see my updated CSB)

then that's a separate issue, we should fix then.
should i create another issue for that?

> should i create another issue for that?

I think it should be a separate issue, yes plz.
@szymonlesisz if you setValue and trigger the validation, it's working right? https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-useform-template-forked-j4wqk?file=/src/index.js
unfortunately no, `{ shouldValidate: true }` in "Step 2" doesn't affect `formState.isValid` (it's still false)

![Screen Shot 2020-09-22 at 7 29 24 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10513364/93865624-ed8a0580-fd09-11ea-93be-83d30a8fcd99.png)

but you didn't set `shouldValidate`

but it is clearing `errors` object as expected tho :)

Edit: id didn't save CSB, now should be there

There are few cases where i don't want to use `shouldValidate` (clearing certain fields to default/empty without triggering `required` error)
I am afraid you probably have to, otherwise i am running cycle here with your issue and this one #2730.

hm, thats not a good news :)
any idea how should i clear fields to default state (empty) without triggering "required" error? and without calling "reset" ?
otherwise, I have to `clearErrors('test', { exact: false })` which will do an object unset rather set to `undefined`. however, an extra arg is probably not great at the lib level.
hmmm, i may try something (having an idea).
tried what's in mind and having no luck and rather complicate things up, i think you should rely on `isValid`, and consider to trigger validation, while i will still think about potential solutions.

thank you very much for your time!
i will relay on `isValid` from now on but i did notice that you closed my issue https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/issues/2972 as "not valid" while it's valid. `isValid` field has invalid value (false) :)

> thank you very much for your time!
> i will relay on `isValid` from now on but i did notice that you closed my issue #2972 as "not valid" while it's valid. `isValid` field has invalid value (false) :)

i thought it was not working because setValue didn't have `shouldValidate`? if that's not the same, i will re-open.

yes, i've put it in to issue description
issue persist in both cases with or without `shouldValidate` 

using `shouldValidate` only affects how `errors` object looks like but does't affect `isValid` field
oops...
